title: Two arrested in connection with New Iberia shootings
content:
Two men have now been arrested in connection with two November shootings in New Iberia.
One has been arrested in connection with the November 7 shooting in which deputies reported the 17-year-old was shot in the leg while he was near the intersection of Hopkins Street and Lombard.
Bryan Dugas, 20, was booked with accessory after the fact to second-degree murder and obstruction of justice. He turned himself in to deputies today.
Deputies are still trying to determine who fired the shots in that case, a spokesman said.
Courtney Washington, 22, was booked with attempted second-degree murder in connection with the November 13 shooting of another 17-year-old. Deputies reported that young man was shot in the stomach. That shooting happened in 600 block of Ambassador West Lemell Drive.
